title: Aye-aye
text: The aye-aye is a lemur native to Madagascar. It uses its long middle finger to tap on trees and find insects, making it a unique nocturnal forager.

title: Saiga Antelope
text: Saiga antelope have distinctive bulbous noses that help filter out dust and regulate their body temperature in the harsh climates of Central Asia.

title: Pangolin
text: Pangolins are covered in scales made of keratin. They are solitary, nocturnal animals that use their strong claws to dig for ants and termites.

title: Fossa
text: The fossa is a carnivorous mammal endemic to Madagascar. It has retractable claws and flexible ankles, allowing it to climb trees and hunt lemurs.

title: Quokka
text: Quokkas are small marsupials found in Western Australia. Known for their friendly appearance, they are often called the 'world's happiest animal'.

title: Tarsier
text: Tarsiers are small primates with large eyes, native to Southeast Asia. They are known for their incredible leaping ability and nocturnal habits.

title: Okapi
text: Okapis are forest giraffes native to the Congo. They have striped legs like zebras and long tongues that help them reach leaves and branches.

title: Axolotl
text: Axolotls are neotenic salamanders native to Mexico. They are known for their ability to regenerate limbs and retain larval features throughout their lives.

title: Kakapo
text: The kakapo is a flightless parrot from New Zealand. It is nocturnal and has a strong, musky odor that helps it attract mates during breeding season.

title: Narwhal
text: Narwhals are Arctic whales known for their long, spiral tusks. These tusks are actually elongated teeth that can grow up to 10 feet long.

title: Shoebill
text: Shoebills are large, prehistoric-looking birds found in East Africa. They have a distinctive shoe-shaped bill and are known for their slow, deliberate movements.

title: Binturong
text: Binturongs, also known as bearcats, are native to Southeast Asia. They have a prehensile tail and emit a scent similar to popcorn when marking territory.

title: Gerenuk
text: Gerenuks are antelopes with long necks found in East Africa. They stand on their hind legs to browse on tall bushes and trees, giving them a giraffe-like appearance.

title: Maned Wolf
text: Maned wolves are South American canids with long legs and reddish fur. They are solitary and have a distinctive, musky odor used for communication.

title: Sunda Colugo
text: Sunda colugos, or flying lemurs, are gliding mammals found in Southeast Asia. They have a large membrane that allows them to glide between trees.
